{{Use mdy dates|date=July 2014}} {{Infobox person | image = George Hotz.jpg | image_size = 200px | name = George Hotz | birth_name = George Francis Hotz Jr. | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1989|10|02}} | birth_place = [[Glen Rock, New Jersey]], US | other_names = geohot | nationality = American | education = [[Bergen County Academies]] | alma_mater = [[Carnegie Mellon University]] | notable_works = Jailbreak, comma.ai | URL = {{URL|http://www.geohot.com}} }}
'''George Francis Hotz''' (born October 2, 1989), alias '''geohot''', is an American [[Hacker (term)|hacker]] and [[creative consumer]] known for [[unlock phone|unlocking]] the [[iPhone (1st generation)|iPhone]], allowing the phone to be used with other [[wireless carrier]]s, contrary to [[AT&T]]'s and [[Apple Inc.|Apple]]'s intentions.<ref> {{cite news|last = Stone|first = Brad|author2=John Biggs|title = With Software and Soldering, AT&T's Lock on iPhone Is Undone |work = New York Times |page = C-1| url = http://select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00717FD3A580C768EDDA10894DF404482|date = August 25, 2007|accessdate = September 2, 2007}} </ref><ref name=cnbc>{{cite news|title = Interview with 17 year old iPhone hacker|publisher = CNBC|date = September 30, 2007|url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mG6Qf8-SufM}}</ref> He developed the limera1n [[iOS Jailbreaking|jailbreak tool]] and [[booting|bootrom]] exploit for iOS. He is also noted for his technical efforts and publicity with reverse engineering the [[PlayStation 3]] [[video game console]], and for subsequently being sued by and settling with [[Sony]]. As of September 2015, he is working on his [[vehicle automation]] [[machine learning]] company comma.ai.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|title = The First Person to Hack the iPhone Built a Self-Driving Car. In His Garage.|url = https://www.bloomberg.com/features/2015-george-hotz-self-driving-car/|website = Bloomberg.com|accessdate = 2015-12-16}}</ref>
==Personal life== He attended the [[Bergen County Academies]], a [[magnet school|magnet]] [[public high school]] in [[Hackensack, New Jersey]]. He attended [[Academy for Engineering and Design Technology]].<ref>{{cite news |last=McKay |first=Martha |title=Tech whiz cracks code tying it to AT&T network |publisher=[[The Record (Bergen County)|The Record]] |location=[[Bergen County, New Jersey]] |date=August 24, 2007 |url= http://northjersey.com/page.php?qstr=eXJpcnk3ZjczN2Y3dnFlZUVFeXk4NDgmZmdiZWw3Zjd2cWVlRUV5eTcxODU2MTMmeXJpcnk3ZjcxN2Y3dnFlZUVFeXkz | deadurl=yes|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20071014041013/http://northjersey.com/page.php?qstr=eXJpcnk3ZjczN2Y3dnFlZUVFeXk4NDgmZmdiZWw3Zjd2cWVlRUV5eTcxODU2MTMmeXJpcnk3ZjcxN2Y3dnFlZUVFeXkz |archivedate=October 14, 2007 |accessdate=October 20, 2011}}</ref> Hotz is an alumnus of the [[Center for Talented Youth|Johns Hopkins Center for Talented Youth]] program.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.in.com/george-hotz/profile-103017.html|title=GEORGE HOTZ|accessdate=March 24, 2014}}</ref> Hotz also briefly attended [[Rochester Institute of Technology]]<ref>https://www.rit.edu/news/story.php?id=45766</ref> and [[Carnegie Mellon University]].
==iOS device security== In August 2007, seventeen-year-old George Hotz became the first person reported to carrier-unlock an iPhone.<ref name="Unlocked iPhone">{{youtube | id=tvJ1RGlxe8Q | title=Unlocked iPhone}}</ref><ref name=newyorker>[http://www.newyorker.com/reporting/2012/05/07/120507fa_fact_kushner "Machine Politics: The man who started the hacker wars."],"[[The New Yorker]]", May 7, 2012, accessed April 30, 2012</ref><ref name="IHACKED YOU">{{cite news |last=Kronfeld |first=Melissa Jane |last2=Liddy |first2=Tom |agency=Post Wire Services |title=IHACKED YOU! CODE-CRACKING N.J. KID 'FREES' APPLE CELL |publisher=[[New York Post]] |date=August 25, 2007 |url=https://nypost.com/2007/08/25/ihacked-you/ |accessdate=October 20, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tvJ1RGlxe8Q|title=Unlocked iPhone|date=August 21, 2007|publisher=|accessdate=January 4, 2016|via=YouTube}}</ref> According to Hotz's blog, he traded his second unlocked 8 GB iPhone to Terry Daidone, the founder of [[Certicell]], for a Nissan 350Z and three 8 GB iPhones.<ref name="iphonetrade">[http://iphonejtag.blogspot.com/2007/08/iphone-has-been-traded.html On the iPhone: THE iPhone HAS BEEN TRADED], Accessed May 3, 2008.</ref>
In September 2007, an anonymous group achieved a software-only unlocking method to complement Hotz's hardware-based unlocking method.<ref name="Code to unlock">{{cite news | title=Code to unlock iPhone cracked | publisher=CNN | date=September 1, 2007 | url=http://edition.cnn.com/2007/TECH/09/01/apple.iphone/index.html | access-date=August 2, 2014}}</ref>
On July 13, 2010, Hotz announced the discontinuation of his jailbreaking activities, citing demotivation over the technology and the unwanted personal attention.<ref>{{cite web | title=GeoHot says Goodbye to iPhone Community | url=http://www.tech-exclusive.com/geohot-says-goodbye-to-iphone-community/ | website=Tech-exclusive.com | date=July 13, 2010 | access-date=April 15, 2011 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131013021034/http://www.tech-exclusive.com/geohot-says-goodbye-to-iphone-community/ | archive-date=October 13, 2013 | dead-url=yes}}</ref> Nevertheless, he continued to release new software-based jailbreak techniques until October 2010.<ref>{{cite web | title= Limera1n iOS 4.1 Jailbreak Released By Geohot | url=https://www.geeky-gadgets.com/limera1n-ios-4-1-jailbreak-released-by-geohot-10-10-2010/ | first=Roland | last=Hutchinson | website=Geeky-gadgets.com | date=October 10, 2010 | access-date=February 26, 2018 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101016005247/https://www.geeky-gadgets.com/limera1n-ios-4-1-jailbreak-released-by-geohot-10-10-2010/ | archive-date = October 16, 2010 }}</ref>
==PlayStation 3 security== In December 2009, Hotz announced his initial intentions to breach security on the [[Sony]] [[PlayStation 3]].<!--ref>{{cite web |url=http://geohotps3.blogspot.com/2009/12/real-challenge.html |title=A Real Challenge |publisher=George Hotz |date=December 26, 2009 |accessdate=January 25, 2010}}</ref--> Five weeks later, on January 22, 2010, he announced that he had performed his first theoretical achievement. This consists of the initial read and write access to the machine's system memory as well as [[hypervisor]] level access to the machine's CPU.<!--ref>{{cite web |url=http://geohotps3.blogspot.com |title=On The PlayStation 3 |publisher=George Hotz}}</ref--><!--ref>{{cite web |url=http://geohotps3.blogspot.com/2010/01/hello-hypervisor-im-geohot.html |title=Hello hypervisor, I'm geohot |publisher=George Hotz |date=January 22, 2010 |accessdate=January 25, 2010}}</ref--><ref name="BBC News">{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8478764.stm |title=PlayStation 3 'hacked' by iPhone cracker |publisher=BBC News |date=January 25, 2010 |accessdate=January 25, 2010 |first=Jonathan |last=Fildes}}</ref>
On January 26, 2010, Hotz released the [[exploit (computer security)|exploit]] to the public. On March 28, 2010, Sony responded by announcing their intention to release a PlayStation 3 [[PlayStation 3 system software|firmware update]] that would remove the [[OtherOS]] feature from all models,<ref>[http://blog.us.playstation.com/2010/03/28/ps3-firmware-v3-21-update/ PS3 Firmware (v3.21) Update – PlayStation Blog]</ref> a feature that was already absent on the newer Slim revisions of the machine.{{fact|date=February 2017}}
On July 13, 2010, never having achieved any method of reading, installing, or modifying software on the PS3, Hotz posted a message on his Twitter account stating that he had abandoned his efforts of trying to crack the PS3 any further due to the system security's extreme difficulty.<ref name="gamingbolt.com">[http://gamingbolt.com/2010/07/13/the-ps3-just-too-difficult-to-crack/ The PS3 just too difficult to crack – GamingBolt.com: Video Game News, Reviews, Previews and Blog]. GamingBolt.com. Retrieved on February 16, 2011.</ref>
On December 29, 2010, notable hacking group [[fail0verflow]], known for the reverse engineering of security models found in consumer electronics devices, performed an academic presentation at the 27th Chaos Communications Congress technical conference, of their accomplishments with the PlayStation 3. They presented the methods they'd devised for having successfully penetrated the device's security model, yielding the root signing and encryption keys. These keys are the essential element of a full (and even minimally usable) breach, capable of installing and running any new software on any PlayStation 3 unit.<ref name="f0f at CCC, PS3News">{{cite web |url=https://events.ccc.de/congress/2010/Fahrplan/events/4087.en.html |title=Console Hacking 2010: PS3 Epic Fail |publisher=fail0verflow |work=Chaos Communication Congress |date=December 29, 2010 |accessdate=October 29, 2017}}</ref><ref name="f0f at CCC, YouTube">{{youtube |id=4loZGYqaZ7I |title=27C3 - Chaos Communication Congress 2010 - fail0verflow}}</ref>
On January 2, 2011, Hotz posted a copy of the root keys of the PlayStation 3 on his website.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://psx-scene.com/forums/f6/geohot-here-your-ps3-root-key-now-hello-world-proof-74255/ |title=Geohot: Here is your PS3 Root Key! – Now with "HELLO WORLD" proof! |publisher=PSX-SCENE}}</ref> These keys were later removed from his website as a result of legal action by Sony against fail0verflow and Hotz. In response to his continued publication of PS3 exploit information, Sony filed on January 11, 2011 for an application for a temporary restraining order (TRO) against him in the US District Court of Northern California.<ref>[https://www.scribd.com/doc/46739945/Motion-for-TRO Motion for TRO]. Scribd.com (January 12, 2011). Retrieved on February 16, 2011.</ref> On January 14, 2011, Hotz appeared in an interview on G4's ''The Loop'', where he explained his involvement with the PlayStation 3.<ref name="GeoHot at G4">{{cite av media | title=Sony vs. GeoHot Hacker Lawsuit | publisher=G4 | url=http://www.g4tv.com/videos/50733/sony-vs-geohot-hacker-lawsuit/ | date=January 13, 2011 | accessdate=August 3, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.newsden.net/geohot-vs-sony-ps3-jailbreak-lawsuit-and-the-interview-6008 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120724094705/http://www.newsden.net/geohot-vs-sony-ps3-jailbreak-lawsuit-and-the-interview-6008/ | archivedate=July 24, 2012 | title=GeoHot vs Sony – PS3 Jailbreak, Lawsuit and the Interview | publisher=Newsden | date=January 16, 2011 | accessdate=August 2, 2014}}</ref>
===Sony lawsuit=== {{main article|Sony Computer Entertainment America, Inc. v. Hotz}} After the root keys of the console were published, Sony initiated litigation against George Hotz and predecessor PlayStation 3 hacking group known as fail0verflow. Hotz published his commentary on the case, including a song about the "disaster" of Sony.<ref name="geohot's Sony rap">{{youtube |id=9iUvuaChDEg |title=The Light It Up Contest}}</ref> Sony in turn has demanded social media sites, including YouTube, to hand over IP addresses of people who visited Geohot's social pages and videos; the latter being the case only for those who "watched the video and 'documents reproducing all records or usernames and IP addresses that have posted or published comments in response to the video".<ref name="wired_201112">{{cite web | url=https://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2011/03/geohot-site-unmasking/ | title=Judge Lets Sony Unmask Visitors to PS3-Jailbreaking Site | publisher=Condé Nast Digital | work=Wired.com | date=March 4, 2011 | accessdate=December 6, 2011 | author=Kravets, David | quote=A federal magistrate is granting Sony the right to acquire the internet IP addresses of anybody who has visited PlayStation 3 hacker George Hotz’s website from January 2009 to the present. Thursday’s decision by Magistrate Joseph Spero to allow Sony to subpoena Hotz’s web provider (.pdf) raises a host of web-privacy concerns. Respected for his iPhone hacks and now the PlayStation 3 jailbreak, Hotz is accused of breaching the Digital Millennium Copyright Act and other laws after he published an encryption key and software tools on his website that allow Playstation owners to gain complete control of their consoles from the firmware on up. Sony also won subpoenas (.pdf) for data from YouTube and Google, as part of its lawsuit against the 21-year-old New Jersey hacker, as well as Twitter account data linked to Hotz, who goes by the handle GeoHot.}}</ref>
[[PayPal]] has granted Sony access to Geohot's PayPal account,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://gamepolitics.com/2011/03/16/george-hotz-paypal-subpoena-limited-california-court-docs-reveal|title=George Hotz PayPal Subpoena Limited to California, Court Docs Reveal}}</ref> and the judge of the case granted Sony permission to view the IP addresses of everyone who visited geohot.com. In April 2011, it was revealed that Sony and Hotz had settled the lawsuit out of court, on the condition that Hotz would never again resume any hacking work on Sony products.<ref name="joystiq_201112">{{cite web | url=https://www.engadget.com/2011/04/11/sony-and-playstation-3-jailbreaker-george-hotz-settle-out-of-cou/ | title=Sony and PlayStation 3 jailbreaker George Hotz settle out of court | publisher=AOL, Inc. | work=Joystiq | date=April 11, 2011 | accessdate=December 6, 2011 | author=Gilbert, Ben | quote=After a short but rather storied history, infamous PlayStation 3 jailbreaker George "GeoHot" Hotz and Sony Computer Entertainment of America have settled their legal dispute, with a statement on the PlayStation Blog stating the two parties "reached an agreement in principle" around 10 days ago. According to said agreement, Hotz has "consented to a permanent injunction," meaning he super swears he won't do it again (legally speaking, of course), though no other terms are given. We were told by an SCEA rep that the terms of the settlement (beyond what was disclosed) are confidential.}}</ref>
At the end of April 2011, an anonymous hacker broke into the [[PlayStation Network]] and [[PlayStation Network outage|stole personal information of some 77 million users]]. Hotz denied any responsibility for the attack, and said "Running homebrew and exploring security on your devices is cool; hacking into someone else's server and stealing databases of user info is not cool".<ref name="wired_201112"/>
==Rooting the AT&T and Verizon Galaxy S5== In June 2014, Hotz<ref>{{cite web|url=http://forum.xda-developers.com/member.php?u=3280118|title=geohot|publisher=|accessdate=January 4, 2016}}</ref> published a [[Rooting (Android OS)|root exploit]] software hack for [[Samsung Galaxy S5]] devices used in the US market.<ref name=ibt>{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/geohot-towelroot-exploit-roots-galaxy-s5-devices-att-verizon-1602368|title=Geohot Towelroot Exploit Roots Galaxy S5 Devices On AT&T And Verizon|author=Luke Villapaz|date=June 16, 2014|work=International Business Times|accessdate=January 4, 2016}}</ref> The exploit is itself built around Linux kernel CVE-2014-3153,<ref name=debian>{{cite web|url=https://lists.debian.org/debian-security-announce/2014/msg00130.html|title=[SECURITY] [DSA 2949-1] linux security update|publisher=|accessdate=January 4, 2016}}</ref><ref name=oneclick /> which was discovered by hacker Pinkie Pie, and it involves an issue in the Futex subsystem that in turn allows for privilege escalation. The exploit, known as ''[https://towelroot.com towelroot]'', was designated a "one-click Android rooting tool"<ref name=oneclick>[http://thehackernews.com/2014/06/towelroot-one-click-android-rooting.html Towelroot: One-Click Android Rooting Tool Released By Geohot], The Hacker News, June 1, 2015.</ref> by the hacking community because it was designed to be installed quickly like an [[Mobile app|App]]; other rooting hacks were typically uploaded from a nearby PC with a cable and necessitated rebooting the device with a special set of key presses.
Although originally released for the Verizon Galaxy S5, the root exploit was made compatible with most Android devices available at that time. For example, it was tested and found to work with the AT&T Galaxy S5, Nexus 5, and Galaxy S4 Active. Updates continued to be applied to the root exploit to increase its capabilities with other devices running Android.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=2783157|title=I'm throwing a party and you should come **G... - Verizon Samsung Galaxy S 5|work=XDA Developers|accessdate=January 4, 2016}}</ref> Updates to the Android operating system closed the source of the exploit. Samsung officially responded to the towelroot exploit by releasing updated software designed to be immune from the exploit.<ref name="samsung-resp">[https://www.samsungknox.com/en/blog/samsung%E2%80%99s-official-response-%E2%80%9Ctowelroot%E2%80%9D Samsung's official response to "Towelroot"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150316045205/https://www.samsungknox.com/en/blog/samsung%E2%80%99s-official-response-%E2%80%9Ctowelroot%E2%80%9D |date=March 16, 2015 }} Announcements: 7 Jul 2014, Samsung KNOX News</ref>
==Career== In addition to having made a meaningful side income from public donations solicited for his exploits,<ref name=newyorker/> Hotz has been employed at Facebook and Google.
On June 27, 2011, ZDNet freelance reporter, Emil Protalinski reported that according to a Facebook spokesman, Hotz had been hired by the company in an unknown role.<ref>{{cite news |last=Protalinski |first=Emil |title=Geohot reportedly now works for Facebook (update: Facebook confirms) |work=News & Blogs / Friending Facebook |publisher=[[ZDNet]] |date=June 27, 2011 |url= http://www.zdnet.com/blog/facebook/geohot-reportedly-now-works-for-facebook-update-facebook-confirms/1730 |accessdate=October 20, 2011}}</ref> However, according to a CNET article, he had actually been employed since May, which was confirmed by Facebook.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-13506_3-20075028-17/geohot-now-a-facebook-employee/|title=Geohot now a Facebook employee|last=Reisinger|first=Don|date=June 28, 2011|work=The Digital Home|accessdate=October 20, 2011|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111020001726/http://news.cnet.com/8301-13506_3-20075028-17/geohot-now-a-facebook-employee/|archivedate=October 20, 2011|publisher=[[CNET|c|net]]}}<!--If the current archiveurl fails due to the Google Cache on the page being flushed, use this one: http://news.cnet.com/8301-13506_3-20075028-17/geohot-now-a-facebook-employee/ --></ref> In January 2012, Hotz was no longer employed by Facebook.<ref name=newyorker /><ref>[http://articles.businessinsider.com/2012-01-24/tech/30658124_1_george-hotz-location-data-iphone Famous iPhone Hacker George Hotz Has Left Facebook] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120128210314/http://articles.businessinsider.com/2012-01-24/tech/30658124_1_george-hotz-location-data-iphone |date=January 28, 2012 }}</ref>
On July 16, 2014, Google hired Hotz to work in their software security auditing team called [[Project Zero (Google)|Project Zero]], which "hopes to find zero-day vulnerabilities before the NSA".<ref>{{cite web|last1=Bright|first1=Peter|title=Google "Project Zero" hopes to find zero-day vulnerabilities before the NSA|url=https://arstechnica.com/security/2014/07/google-project-zero-hopes-to-find-zero-day-vulnerabilities-before-the-nsa/|website=Ars Technica|publisher=Condé Nast|accessdate=July 16, 2014}}</ref> Hotz worked in Project Zero for 5 months where he developed Qira - an open source program for dynamically analysing application binaries.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://qira.me/|title=qira|website=qira.me|language=en|access-date=2018-08-17}}</ref>
In January 2015, Vicarious.com hired Hotz to develop AI algorithms where he worked for 7 months.{{fact|date=February 2017}}
==comma.ai== Since September 2015, Hotz has been working on his own AI startup called comma.ai.<ref>[https://www.linkedin.com/pub/george-hotz/76/664/b38 George Hotz's LinkedIn Profile]</ref> In an interview with Bloomberg, Hotz revealed he is building vehicular automation technology based on artificial intelligence algorithms. Hotz has built a working self-driving 2016 Acura ILX, which he demonstrated on the I-280 in a video.<ref name=":0" /> The video prompted a cease and desist letter from the [[California Department of Motor Vehicles]].<ref>https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2016/apr/05/george-hotz-comma-self-driving-car-tesla-elon-musk</ref> Hotz wants to sell his technology to [[Tesla Motors]] and he has reported to have talked to CEO [[Elon Musk]] and is working on proving his technology to be superior to that of [[Mobileye]], which, at the time, was used for Tesla Autopilot.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":0" /> <ref name="teslamotors.com">{{cite web |url=https://www.tesla.com/support/correction-article-first-person-hack-iphone-built-self-driving-car |title=Correction to article: "The First Person to Hack the iPhone Built a Self-Driving Car" |publisher=Tesla, Inc. |accessdate=October 29, 2017}}</ref><ref name="ibtimes.com">{{cite web |url=http://www.ibtimes.com/tesla-motors-mobileye-announce-breakup-ahead-gigafactory-opening-2395094 |title=Tesla Motors & Mobileye Announce Breakup Ahead of Gigafactory Opening |website=[[International Business Times]] |accessdate=October 29, 2017}}</ref> Hotz claims that Musk offered him $12 million (minus $1 million for every month it took Hotz to work on the task) to create a driving system that could replace the MobilEye solution currently used in Tesla vehicles.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2016/3/15/11225314/george-hotz-self-driving-car-autopilot-tesla-speech-sxsw-2016|title=George Hotz promised to end capitalism in a manic sermon at SXSW|date=2016-03-15|publisher=[[The Verge]]|quote=Then he met with Elon Musk, who asked him to make a vision solution for self-driving cars that would rival the MobileEye tech Tesla was already working with. Then Musk offered him $12 million (minus $1 million for every month it took Hotz to work on the task).}}</ref> Tesla later released a statement on their website citing corrections to the Bloomberg article, stressing that their autopilot system was developed in-house, with a vision chip component from MobilEye, instead of one separate autopilot system manufactured by MobilEye, as suggested by Bloomberg reporter Ashlee Vance.<ref name="teslamotors.com"/> Tesla CEO Elon Musk offered advice on Hotz's [[autonomous car|self-driving car]] project in a December 2015 interview.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fortune.com/2015/12/21/elon-musk-interview/|title=Elon Musk Says Tesla Vehicles Will Drive Themselves in Two Years|author=Kirsten Korosec|date=December 21, 2015|work=Fortune|accessdate=January 4, 2016}}</ref>
On October 27, 2016, the [[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration|NHTSA]] informed Hotz that this product was legally required to comply with [[Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standards]], and requested information that would confirm such compliance.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.scribd.com/document/329218929/2016-10-27-Special-Order-Directed-to-Comma-ai|title=Special order directed to comma.ai|accessdate=October 28, 2016}}</ref> A day later, George Hotz tweeted from Shenzhen that the comma one was cancelled.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/comma_ai/status/791958413345382400|title=The comma one is cancelled...|accessdate=October 28, 2016}}</ref> Kristen Lee stated on Jalopnik that the NHTSA was simply trying to open a dialog, and commented that "Instead, they got the worst attitude possible from Silicon Valley: try and regulate us, thought leaders, and we’ll take our ball and go home."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://jalopnik.com/the-feds-were-right-to-question-the-safety-of-the-999-1788330916|title=The Feds Were Right To Question The Safety Of The $999 Self-Driving Kit |last1=Lee |first1=Kristen |access-date=October 29, 2016 }}</ref>
comma.ai open sourced their self driving car software on November 30, 2016, emphasising its intended use for research without any warranty.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2016/11/30/13779336/comma-ai-autopilot-canceled-autonomous-car-software-free|title=George Hotz is giving away the code behind his self-driving car project|accessdate=May 13, 2017}}</ref>
On September 14th, 2018, comma.ai announced Hotz would become the Head of Research Team for the project, and appointed Riccardo Biasini as the new CEO of the company.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://medium.com/@comma_ai/a-message-from-the-new-ceo-of-comma-ai-4db20da0f670|title=A message from the new CEO of comma.ai|last=ai|first=comma|date=2018-09-14|website=comma ai|access-date=2018-09-23}}</ref>
==Other activities and recognition== Hotz was a finalist at the 2004 [[Intel International Science and Engineering Fair|ISEF]] competition in Portland, Oregon with his project "The Mapping Robot". Recognition included interviews on the ''[[Today (NBC program)|Today Show]]'' and ''Larry King''.<ref>[https://member.societyforscience.org/sslpage.aspx?pid=436 Society for Science & the Public – Intel ISEF – 2004 Portland SAO Award Winners]. Societyforscience.org. Retrieved on February 16, 2011.</ref> Hotz was a finalist at the 2005 ISEF competition, with his project "The Googler".<ref>[http://www.intel.com/pressroom/archive/photos/isef_2005_photos.htm Photos - Intel Science and Engineering Fair 2005]. Intel.com. Retrieved on April 15, 2011.</ref> Continuing with robots, Hotz competed in his school's highly successful Titanium Knights battlebots team.
Hotz competed in the 2007 Intel International Science and Engineering Fair, a science competition for high school students, where his 3D imaging project, entitled "I want a [[Holodeck]]", received awards and prizes in several categories including a $20,000 Intel scholarship.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20101104183648/http://www.societyforscience.org/Document.Doc?id=80 Grand Awards Ceremony of the Intel International Science and Engineering Fair 2007]. Intel Education. Retrieved August 24, 2007.</ref> He travelled to Sweden to speak about the project at the [[Stockholm International Youth Science Seminar]].<ref>{{sv icon}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20080423035941/http://www.fuf.org/swe/verksamhet/siyss/participants Participants / SIYSS / Verksamhet / Förbundet Unga Forskare - Förbundet Unga Forskare]. Web.archive.org (April 23, 2008). Retrieved on April 15, 2011.</ref>
Hotz has received considerable attention in mainstream media, including interviews on the ''Today Show'', [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]], [[CNN]], [[NBC]], [[CBS]], [[G4 (U.S. TV channel)|G4]], [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]],<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MbRKA5OmtHQ|title=YouTube|publisher=|accessdate=January 4, 2016}}</ref> [[CNBC]],<ref name=cnbc /> and articles in several magazines, newspapers, and websites, including [[Forbes]],<ref>[https://www.forbes.com/forbes/2007/0723/060.html Junior R&D - Forbes.com]. Members.forbes.com. Retrieved on April 15, 2011.</ref> and [[BBC]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8478764.stm|title=PlayStation 3 'hacked' by iPhone cracker|work=BBC News|last=Fildes|first=Jonathan|accessdate=January 25, 2009|date=January 25, 2010}}</ref>
In March 2008, PC World magazine listed Hotz as one of the top 10 Overachievers under 21.<ref>Tynan, Dan. (March 9, 2008) [http://www.pcworld.com/article/143201/article.html Meet the Whiz Kids: 10 Overachievers Under 21 - Page 10]. PCWorld. Retrieved on April 15, 2011.</ref>
In August 2013, Hotz attended [[DEF CON]] with Carnegie Mellon's Plaid Parliament of Pwning (PPP). PPP placed first in the DEF CON Capture the Flag (CTF) tournament.<ref>[https://www.cnbc.com/id/101179977#. Cyberteams duke it out in the World Series of hacking - cnbc.com]. cnbc.com. Retrieved on Nov 8, 2013.</ref> Later in 2013, Hotz also competed in CSAW 2013. Working alone, Hotz took first place under the pseudonym tomcr00se.<ref>[http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/nyu-poly-cyber-security-awareness-week-announces-winners-of-worlds-biggest-student-contests-232353621.html NYU-Poly Cyber Security Awareness Week Announces Winners of World's Biggest Student Contests - prnewswire.com]. prnewswire.com. Retrieved on Nov 18, 2013.</ref> In August 2014, Hotz once again competed as part of Carnegie Mellon's Plaid Parliament of Pwning to win the DEF CON CTF tournament for a second year in a row. The team also won the DEF CON "Crack Me If You Can" tournament.<ref>[https://www.cylab.cmu.edu/news_events/news/2014/cylab-teams-win-defcon-22-contests.html NYU-Poly CMU CyLab PPP and CUPS teams win “Capture the Flag” and “Crack Me If You Can" contests at DEFCON 22 - cylab.cmu.edu]. cylab.cmu.edu. Retrieved on Aug 20, 2014.</ref>

{{Infobox artist | name = Gonçalo Mabunda | image =Goncalo and Clinton.jpg | caption = Mabunda with Bill Clinton in 2017 | image_size = | birth_date = 1 January 1975 | birth_place = Maputo | notable_works = Arms into Art, Throne of an African King }}
'''Gonçalo Mabunda''' was born on January 1, 1975 in [[Maputo]], [[Mozambique]]. He is an artist and anti-war activist. Mabunda has exhibited in important museums such as the [[Centre Georges Pompidou|Center Pompidou]] in Paris, the [[Venice Biennale]], the [[Museum of Arts and Design|Museum of Art and Design]] in New York, [http://www.gwbien.com/eng/main/ Gangwon International Biennale], South Korea, , the [[Museum Kunstpalast|Museum Kunst Palast]] in Dusseldorf, the [https://www.southbankcentre.co.uk/whats-on/exhibitions/hayward-gallery-art/andreas-gursky Hayward Gallery] in London, the [[Mori Art Museum]] in Tokyo, the [[Johannesburg Art Gallery]], the [[Tropenmuseum|Tropen Museum]], Amsterdam, [[Armed Forces Museum (Norway)|Norway Army Museum]], [https://www.nmm.nl/en/ Netherlands Army Museum], [[Swedish Army Museum|Sweden Army Museum]] and many more.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.magnin-a.com/fr/artistes/presentation/858/goncalo-mabunda|title=Gonçalo Mabunda|access-date=2017-06-18|language=fr}}</ref>
Mabunda started his work in the context of a project implemented since 1995, by the Christian Council of Mozambique (CCM) that has been scouring the country and collecting weapons from individuals and communities after a civil war that lasted almost twenty years. In this project some weapons are destroyed while others are deactivated and given to men and women like Mabunda, to sculpt into art. Some 800,000 weapons have been collected since the CCM launched this project, called Transforming Guns into Hopes.
The name, is inspired by a Bible verse from the book of Micah: 'They will hammer their swords into ploughshares and their spears into pruning hooks'.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/katherine-baldwin/goncalo-mabunda-mozambique-turning-weapons-of-war-in_b_1284882.html|title=Turning Weapons of War into Works of Art|website=HuffPost UK|language=en-GB|access-date=2017-06-18}}</ref>
Mabunda is a partner artist of the African Artists for Development, an organisation that backs community development projects associated with works by contemporary artists.
== Art == Gonçalo Mabunda uses Kalashnikovs, rockets, pistols, and shell casing in order to make anthropomorphic figures out of the deconstructed weapons.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/afrique/article/2015/06/18/goncalo-mabunda-et-la-guerre-civile-mozambicaine-recyclee_4656813_3212.html|title=Gonçalo Mabunda et la guerre civile mozambicaine recyclée|date=2015-06-18|work=Le Monde.fr|access-date=2017-06-16|language=fr|issn=1950-6244}}</ref> By turning weapons into life-like figures, Mabunda literally turns death into life. The figurines are also representative of the over 1 million people killed during his country’s civil war.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.jackbellgallery.com/artists/29-Gon%C3%A7alo-Mabunda/overview/|title=Gonçalo Mabunda|website=Jack Bell Gallery|language=en|access-date=2017-06-16}}</ref> Mabunda has also lost relatives during the war, which makes working with and deconstructing weapons used during the 16-year war more important for him.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/gallery/2014/mar/06/art-of-war-melding-arms-into-weapons-of-mass-attraction-in-pictures|title=Art of war: melding arms into weapons of mass attraction – in pictures|last=Elie|first=Janise|date=2014-03-06|website=the Guardian|access-date=2017-06-16}}</ref> He makes thrones and masks out of these deactived weapons used during the [[Mozambican Civil War|Mozambique Civil War.]] The masks are based on traditional Sub-Saharan African masks, however, the original twist on the art form by creating them out of weapons is unique to Mabunda. Representing power, Mabunda’s thrones mock how the traditional power rests on weapons. By using weapons, Mabunda’s work carries the message of how further violence can be prevented, and that destroying the weapons of war can be done in an aesthetic and artistic way.<ref name="auto">{{Cite web|url=http://www.goncalo-mabunda.com/en/case-studies|title=CASE STUDIES {{!}} gonçalo mabunda|website=www.goncalo-mabunda.com|access-date=2017-06-16}}</ref> Mabunda’s art directly challenges the absurdity of war. His work has a modernist style to it and has been compared to the work of [[Georges Braque|Braque]] and [[Pablo Picasso|Picasso]].<ref name="auto"/>
== Reception == Gonçalo Mabunda’s artwork has been followed by the international press, French Newspaper Le Monde, huffingtonPost from the UK<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/katherine-baldwin/goncalo-mabunda-mozambique-turning-weapons-of-war-in_b_1284882.html|title=Turning Weapons of War into Works of Art|website=HuffPost UK|language=en-GB|access-date=2017-06-16}}</ref> are among medias that followed Mabunda’s work effect on his local community.
In 2014, Mabunda was one of 20 African artists to figure in French art collector André Magning publication ''African Stories''.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.magnin-a.com/fr/artistes/presentation/858/goncalo-mabunda|title=Gonçalo Mabunda|access-date=2017-06-16|language=fr}}</ref> In 2015, Mabunda’s works were the main subject of CNN show ''Inside Africa'',<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/01/20/africa/mozambique-art-from-weapons-and-rubble/index.html|title=In Mozambique: Art from weapons and rubble|last=CNN|first=Daisy Carrington and Colin Hancock, for|website=CNN|access-date=2017-06-16}}</ref> a TV series highlighting different economic, social and cultural personalities in Africa.
Former US President [[Bill Clinton]], a fan of Mabunda’s work, commissioned the artist to create trophies for his philanthropic organisation the Clinton Global Initiative.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}}
In July 2017, his pieces were shown in the European Parliament in an exhibition organized by the [[European Centre for Electoral Support (ECES)|European Centre for Electoral Support]] at the occasion of the launch of a handbook produced in the context of a project funded by the European Union on "Preventing Electoral Conflicts and Violence in the countries of the Southern African Development Communities" that includes Mozambique.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} The launching seminar in the European Parliament was chaired by the Member of the European Parliament, [[Judith Sargentini]], former Chief Observer to the EU election observation mission in Mozambique and Tanzania and co-chaired by [[Lojze Peterle|Alojz Peterle]], Member of the European Parliament, former Chief Observer to the EU election observation mission in Kenya.

{{infobox military person | name = '''Hamza bin Osama bin Mohammed bin Awad bin Laden'''
({{lang|ar|حمزة بن أسامة بن محمد بن عوض بن لادن}}} | image = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1989}} | death_date = | birth_place = [[Jeddah]], [[Saudi Arabia]] | death_place = | placeofburial = | death_cause = | occupation = | years_active = | successor = [[Osama Bin Laden]] | religion = | children = | module = {{Infobox military person|embed=yes | allegiance = [[Al-Qaeda]]
[[Jama'at Ansar al-Furqan in Bilad al Sham]] (Rumoredly, since 2017) https://www.investigativeproject.org/6816/can-bin-laden-heir-salvage-jihad-in-syria | branch = | serviceyears = 2010–present | rank = | battles = [[War on Terror]]: *[[War in Afghanistan (2001–present)|War in Afghanistan]] *[[War in North-West Pakistan]] [[Syrian Civil War]] }} }} '''Hamza bin Osama bin Mohammed bin Awad bin Laden''' ({{lang-ar|حمزة بن أسامة بن محمد بن عوض بن لادن}}; born 1989), better known as '''Hamza bin Laden''', is a son of [[Osama bin Laden]]. His father, as well as his brother Khalid, were killed in the [[Death of Osama bin Laden|2011 Navy SEAL raid]].{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/cifamerica/2011/may/05/obama-bin-laden-pr-defeat|title=Obama's Bin Laden coup risks becoming PR defeat|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=2011-03-05|location=London|first=Paul|last=Harris}} ==Early life and family== In January 2001, Hamza (then 12 years old), his father and other family members attended the wedding of his brother Mohammed bin Laden in the southern Afghan city of [[Kandahar]].Adam Robinson, ''Bin Laden: Behind the Mask of the Terrorist'', p.271 Video footage shot in [[Ghazni province]] in November of the same year shows Hamza and some of his siblings handling U.S. helicopter wreckage and working alongside [[Taliban]] resistance.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/1644044.stm|title=Bin Laden sons 'fighting with Taleban'|publisher=[[BBC News]]|accessdate=2007-09-13 | date=2001-11-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mydemocracy.net/counterpunch/osseiran08212006.htm| title=Osama's Confession; Osama's Reprieve|publisher=mydemocracy.net|accessdate=2007-09-13}} In March 2003, it was claimed that Hamza and his brother [[Saad bin Laden]] had been wounded and captured in Ribat, Afghanistan. This claim eventually proved false.{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2003/03/08/1046826566854.html|title=Bin Laden in their sights|work=[[The Sun-Herald]]|accessdate=2007-09-13 |date=2003-03-09}} Hamza married a daughter of [[Abdullah Ahmed Abdullah]] when he was 17 years old.https://english.alarabiya.net/en/features/2018/01/19/New-footage-shows-Hamza-bin-Laden-at-his-wedding-in-Iran.html In August 2018, ''[[The Guardian]]'' quoted Hamza's uncles as saying he had married a daughter of 9/11 hijacker [[Mohamed Atta]].{{cite web|last=Chulov|first=Martin|title=Hamza bin Laden has married daughter of lead 9/11 hijacker, say family|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/aug/05/hamza-bin-laden-marries-daughter-of-911-hijacker-mohammed-atta|website=The Guardian|date=5 August 2018}} However, Hamza's brother [[Omar bin Laden]] denied the report.https://aawsat.com/english/home/article/1355571/exclusive-tehran-sends-hamza-bin-laden-afghanistan ==Career with al-Qaeda== In a 2005 video titled ''The [[Mujahideen]] of Waziristan'', Hamza is shown participating in an [[al-Qaeda]] assault on Pakistani security forces in the south [[Waziristan]] tribal region between Afghanistan and [[Pakistan]].{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/articleshow/1345776.cms|title=Hamza Laden is his father's true successor|work=[[The Times of India]]|accessdate=2007-09-13|date=2005-12-26}} In September 2007, it was reported that he was again in the [[Pakistan tribal belt|tribal belt]] that encompasses the Pakistan/Afghanistan border region taking a senior role with al-Qaeda forces.{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,22396488-663,00.html |title=Bin Laden son Hamza rises to al-Qaida cause|work=[[The Herald Sun]]|accessdate=2007-09-13 |date=2007-09-11 |first=Fox |last=Ap}}{{cite web |url=http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5gGYUj5IDN0XSzX8TSg9TJEjOz7jg|title=Tentacles spread from Al-Qaeda's lair in Pakistan|publisher=[[Agence France-Presse|AFP]] |accessdate=2007-09-13|deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071028171056/http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5gGYUj5IDN0XSzX8TSg9TJEjOz7jg|archivedate=2007-10-28}} In July 2008, [[The Sun (United Kingdom)|''The Sun'']] published a translation of a poem said to be written by Hamza, which had been published on an extremist Islamic Web site. In the poem Hamza wrote "Accelerate the destruction of America, Britain, France and Denmark." In response British MP [[Patrick Mercer]] dubbed Hamza bin Laden the ''Crown Prince of Terror''.{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/news/article1398695.ece#OTC-RSS&ATTR=News|title=Bin Laden's son in web terror rant|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|accessdate=2008-07-09|location=London|first=Simon|last=Hughes|date=2008-07-09}} Hamza bin Laden was implicated in the 2007 assassination of the former Pakistani Prime Minister [[Benazir Bhutto]].{{cite web |url=http://haltingarkansasliberalswithtruth.com/2011/05/11/hamza-bin-laden-wants-to-keep-his-fathers-family-business-of-terror-going|title=Hamza bin Laden wants to keep his father’s family business of terror going |date=2011-05-11|work=The Daily Hatch}} However, according to an interrogation of former al-Qaeda spokesman [[Sulaiman Abu Ghaith]], Hamza was under house arrest in Iran when Bhutto was assassinated and was not released until 2010.http://kronosadvisory.com/Kronos_US_v_Sulaiman_Abu_Ghayth_Statement.1.pdf On 14 August 2015, he released an audio message for the very first time. He called upon followers in Kabul, Baghdad and Gaza to wage jihad, or holy war, on Washington, London, Paris and Tel Aviv.https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-33927562 On 11 May 2016 it was reported he had released an audio message focused on the issues of [[State of Palestine|Palestine]] and the [[Syrian Civil War]]. He said the "blessed Syrian revolution" had made the prospect of "liberating" [[Jerusalem]] more likely. "The Islamic umma (nation) should focus on jihad in al-Sham ([[Syria]]) … and unite the ranks of mujahedin," he said. "There is no longer an excuse for those who insist on division and disputes now that the whole world has mobilised against Muslims."https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/hamza-bin-laden-could-osamas-son-be-the-future-leader-of-al-qaeda-a7024951.html In July 2016, media reported that he had issued an audio message threatening the [[United States]] in revenge for [[Death of Osama bin Laden|his father's death]].{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/osama-bin-laden-son-hamza-vows-revenge-us-for-killing-his-father-in-video-posted-online-a7129281.html|title=Son of Osama bin Laden issues threat of revenge against the US|author=Asma Alabed|date=10 July 2016|website=[[The Independent]]|accessdate=10 July 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/bin-ladens-son-threatens-revenge-us-40470389|title=Bin Laden's Son Threatens Revenge Against US|author=[[Associated Press]] |publisher=[[ABC News]]|accessdate=10 July 2016}} In the 21-minute speech entitled "We Are All Osama", he said "We will continue striking you and targeting you in your country and abroad in response to your oppression of the people of Palestine, Afghanistan, Syria, Iraq, Yemen, Somalia and the rest of the Muslim lands that did not survive your oppression," Hamza said. "As for the revenge by the Islamic nation for Sheikh Osama, may Allah have mercy on him, it is not revenge for Osama the person but it is revenge for those who defended Islam."https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-security-qaeda-idUSKCN0ZQ0AA In May 2017, a recording by Hamza bin Laden was published by [[As-Sahab]], encouraging terrorist attacks against Western targets.{{cite news |url=http://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2017/05/hamza-bin-laden-offers-advice-for-martyrdom-seekers-in-the-west.php |title=Hamza bin Laden offers 'advice for martyrdom seekers in the West' |first=Thomas |last=Joscelyn |date=May 13, 2017 |quote=Hamza bin Laden, the son of al Qaeda founder Osama bin Laden, has released a new message offering "advice" for "martyrdom seekers in the West." Hamza encourages followers to lash out on their own, but only after carefully preparing their attack so they "may inflict damage far beyond anything the enemy has ever imagined." |publisher=[[Foundation for Defense of Democracies]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170514042811/http://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2017/05/hamza-bin-laden-offers-advice-for-martyrdom-seekers-in-the-west.php |archive-date=May 14, 2017}} In the light of his growing influence within al-Qaeda, the United States classified Hamza bin Laden as Specially Designated Global Terrorist in January 2017. This effectively put him on a blacklist aimed at restricting his movement and economic abilities.{{cite news|url=https://www.state.gov/j/ct/rls/other/des/266536.htm|title=State Department Terrorist Designation of Hamza bin Laden|publisher=U.S. Department of State|access-date=2017-01-05}} In May 2017, a video was released in which he calls on his followers to attack Jews, Americans, Westerners and Russians, via [[lone wolf (terrorism)|lone wolf]] attacks using any means possible.{{cite web |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2017/05/15/middleeast/al-qaeda-bin-laden-son/ |title=Latest al Qaeda propaganda highlights bin Laden's son |publisher=[[CNN]]|date=2017-05-05}} ==May 2011 raid== Hamza is the son of Khairiah Sabar of Saudi Arabia, one of bin Laden's three wives who were living in the [[Abbottabad]] compound.{{Cite news|url=http://www.nypost.com/f/print/news/international/offspringing_away_D8Em36hO54wvw7khw7snOO|title=Osama's youngest son escaped capture|author=Chuck Bennett|publisher=New York Post|date=2011-05-11}} [[File:Osama bin Laden compound1.jpg|thumb|Osama bin Laden's last home, in Abbottabad.]] Interrogation of the surviving wives of [[Osama Bin Laden|Osama bin Laden]] by Pakistani intelligence after the raid on the Abbottabad compound revealed Hamza was the only person missing. He was not among those killed or injured. The raid conducted by the [[Naval Special Warfare Development Group|SEAL team]] was thorough: infrared technology, as well as ground troops, remained confident nobody inside the compound had escaped. There were no hidden exit tunnels from the compound.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1385588/Osama-Bin-Laden-Did-Crown-Prince-Terror-escape-special-forces-raid.html|location=London|work=Daily Mail|title=The Bin Laden who got away: Was 'Crown Prince of Terror' the son who escaped U.S. special forces raid?|date=2011-05-10}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/05/11/hamza-bin-laden-escape-raid_n_860537.html|title=Hamza Bin Laden, 'Crown Prince Of Terror,' May Have Escaped Raid (VIDEO)|author=Dean Praetorius|publisher=Huffington Post|date=2011-05-11}} In a letter confiscated in the raid, written by bin Laden and addressed to his "Chief of Staff" [[Atiyah Abd al-Rahman]], bin Laden mentions his desire that Hamza would be educated in [[Qatar]] as a religious scholar so that he could "refute the wrong and the suspicions raised around Jihad."{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/osama-bin-laden-a-lion-in-winter/2012/03/18/gIQADmAKLS_story.html|title=A lion in winter |author=[[David Ignatius]]|work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=2012-03-18}} The same letter revealed that Hamza did not escape the raid because he was not even present in Abbottabad.{{cite web|url=http://zeenews.india.com/news/south-asia/osama-bin-ladens-son-hiding-in-pakistan_773754.html|title=Osama bin Laden’s son hiding in Pakistan?|work=Zee News}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-2-106998-Osamas-son-may-be-hiding-in-Pakistan|title=Osama’s son may be hiding in Pakistan|date=7 May 2012|work=The News International, Pakistan}} Letters from the compound also confirmed that Osama was grooming Hamza to be his heir apparent following the death of Hamza's older brother Saad in a 2009 US drone strike.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/al-qaeda/8512008/What-next-for-Brand-Bin-Laden.html|title=What next for Brand Bin Laden?|work=The Daily Telegraph|author=David Gardner|date=May 14, 2011|accessdate=September 11, 2012}}{{cite news |url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/iran-double-crossed-osama-bin-laden/story-fnb64oi6-1226348138493|title=Iran double-crossed Osama bin Laden|publisher=The Australian|author=Christina Lamb|date=May 7, 2012|accessdate=September 11, 2012}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.googleusercontent.co.in/2016/07/bin-ladens-son-threatens-revenge-220.html|title=Bin Laden's son threatens revenge against US - Google User Contents- Trending Things You Search in Google!|website=www.googleusercontent.co.in|access-date=2016-07-11}} ==See also== {{Portal|Biography|Saudi Arabia|Afghanistan|Pakistan|Terrorism}} *[[Bin Laden family]] ==References== {{reflist|30em}} '''Henrik Gustaf Ulfvenklou''' (1756–28 September 1819), was a Swedish [[Mysticism|mystic]] and [[Mediumship|medium]] who gained a great influence in the circles of [[Charles XIII of Sweden]] by claiming to communicate with the spirits of the dead.
Lieuntenant Ulfenklou arrived in Stockholm in 1783, where he made success in the esoteric circle around Duke Charles. He claimed he stood in contact with the duke's dead mother, [[Louisa Ulrika of Prussia]], whose spirit he sent to observe Charles's brother the king, [[Gustav III of Sweden]], who was in Italy at that time (1784). He sent a warning with a prediction to Gustav, which is said to have caused damage in the relationship between Charles and Gustav. [[Gustaf Adolf Reuterholm|Reuterholm]] disliked him and had him sent away, and when he returned in 1785, Reuterholm was to have "exposed" him to Charles. His public career then ended, but he continued to have influence over Charles through correspondence.

{{Use mdy dates|date=January 2017}} {{Infobox serial killer | name = Herb Baumeister | image = Herbert Richard Baumeister (serial killer).png | caption = {{Circa|1986}} Mugshot | birth_name = Herbert Richard Baumeister | birth_date = {{Birth date|1947|04|07}} | birth_place = [[Indianapolis]], [[Indiana]], U.S. | death_date = {{Death date and age|1996|07|03|1947|01|07}} | death_place = [[Pinery Provincial Park]], [[Grand Bend]], [[Ontario]], Canada | cause = [[Suicide]] | alias = Brian Smart | victims = 11–20 (not confirmed, died before trial) | country = USA | states = [[Indiana]] and possibly [[Ohio]] | beginyear = 1980s | endyear = 1996 | apprehended = | sentence = N/A }}
'''Herbert Richard Baumeister''' (April 7, 1947 – July 3, 1996) was an American man who was suspected of being a [[serial killer]]. A resident of [[Westfield, Indiana|Westfield]], [[Indiana]], Baumeister was under investigation for murdering over a dozen men in the early 1990s, most of whom were last seen at gay bars. Police found human remains on Baumeister's property and issued an arrest warrant, after which he fled to [[Canada]] and subsequently committed [[suicide]] before he could be brought to trial. He never confessed to the crimes and his [[suicide note]] made no mention of the murder allegations.<ref name="Albert"/> He was later linked to a series of murders of at least nine men along [[Interstate 70]], which occurred in the early to mid-1980s.
==Early life== Baumeister was born in [[Indianapolis]], [[Indiana]], the oldest of four children born to Herbert and Elizabeth Baumeister.<ref name="People1996">{{cite journal|last1=Jerome|first1=Richard|last2=Weinstein|first2=Fannie|title=While Julie Was Away|journal=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=December 23, 1996|volume=46|issue=26|url=http://people.com/archive/while-julie-was-away-vol-46-no-26/|accessdate=January 17, 2015|publisher=[[Time Inc.]]|issn=0093-7673}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Longtime anesthesiologist Herbert E. Baumeister dies|url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/21146233/the_indianapolis_star/|accessdate=June 21, 2018|work=The Indianapolis Star|date=November 13, 1986|page=48|via=[[Newspapers.com]]}} {{free access}}</ref> His childhood was reportedly normal. By the onset of [[adolescence]], however, he began exhibiting [[anti-social behavior]]; acquaintances later recalled the young Baumeister playing with dead animals and urinating on a teacher's desk. In his teens, he was diagnosed with [[schizophrenia]], but did not receive further [[psychiatric]] treatment.<ref name="Albert">{{Cite web|url=http://maamodt.asp.radford.edu/Psyc%20405/serial%20killers/Baumeister,%20Herb%20-%20fall,%202005.pdf|title=Herb Baumeister "The I-70 Strangler"|author1=Natasha Albert |author2=Erin Allen |author3=Sherri Armistead |author4=Josh Bradley |date=|website=|publisher=Department of Psychology, Radford University|access-date=}}</ref> In 1965, Baumeister attended [[Indiana University]] for a semester before dropping out, and later returned in 1967.<ref name="People1996"/> In 1972, he attended a semester at [[Butler University]].<ref name="Star15-9-1996">{{cite news|last1=Labalme|first1=Jenny|title=Businessman puzzled people in life and death|url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/21146253/the_indianapolis_star/|accessdate=June 21, 2018|work=The Indianapolis Star|date=September 15, 1996|pages=41, 49|via=Newspapers.com}} {{free access}}</ref> As an adult, he drifted through a series of jobs, marked by a strong work ethic, but also by more and increasingly bizarre behavior.<ref name="Star15-9-1996"/>
Baumeister married Juliana "Julie" Saiter in November 1971, a union that produced three children.<ref name="People1996"/><ref name="Star15-9-1996"/><ref>{{cite news|last1=Meredith|first1=Robyn|title=Seven Skeletons, and a Suburb in Shock|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1996/10/16/us/seven-skeletons-and-a-suburb-in-shock.html|accessdate=January 4, 2017|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=October 16, 1996}}</ref> Julie later said they had been sexually intimate only six times in over 25 years of marriage.<ref name="Albert"/> In the 1970s, he was committed to a psychiatric hospital by his father. His wife said he was "hurting and needed help."<ref name="People1996"/> He founded the successful Sav-A-Lot thrift store chain (two stores total) in Indianapolis in 1988<!-- People1996 ref says 1989 --> (not affiliated with [[Save-A-Lot]] grocery store chain).<ref name="Star15-9-1996"/>
==Investigation== By the early 1990s, investigators with the Marion County Sheriff's Department and the [[Indianapolis Police Department]] began investigating the disappearances of gay men of similar age, height, and weight in the Indianapolis area. In 1992, investigators were contacted by a man named Tony Harris claiming that a [[gay bar]] patron calling himself "Brian Smart" had killed a friend of his and had attempted to kill him with a pool hose during an [[erotic asphyxiation]] session. Harris eventually happened to see this same man again in August 1995, following him and noting a license plate number.<ref name="Albert"/> From this data, police identified "Brian Smart" as Herb Baumeister.
Investigators approached Baumeister, told him he was a suspect in the disappearances, and asked to search his house. When Baumeister refused, investigators confronted his wife, Julie, who also forbade police to search the house. By June 1996, however, Julie had become sufficiently frightened by her husband's mood swings and erratic behavior that, after filing for [[divorce]], she consented to a search.<ref name="People1996"/> The search of the {{convert|18|acre|m2|adj=on}} estate, Fox Hollow Farm, was conducted while Baumeister was on vacation; it turned up the remains of eleven men, eight of whom were identified.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Higgins|first1=Will|title=House with dark past fulfills family's dream|url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/21146336/chillicothe_gazette/|accessdate=June 21, 2018|work=[[Chillicothe Gazette]]|date=October 30, 2012|page=4A|via=Newspapers.com}} {{free access}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Mitchell|first1=Dawn|title=Retro Indy: Heinous crimes of serial killers in Indiana|url=http://www.indystar.com/wlna/news/history/retroindy/2014/09/12/indiana-serial-killers/15402833/|accessdate=January 12, 2017|work=The Indianapolis Star|date=February 29, 2016}}</ref>
With a warrant out for his arrest, Baumeister fled to [[Ontario]], Canada, where he committed suicide at [[Pinery Provincial Park]] by shooting himself in the head. In his suicide note, he described his failing marriage and business as his reason for killing himself.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Labalme|first1=Jenny|title=Suicide note mentions marriage, business but not bones|url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/21146358/the_indianapolis_star/|accessdate=June 21, 2018|work=[[The Indianapolis Star]]|date=July 6, 1996|pages=1–2|via=Newspapers.com}} {{free access}}</ref> He did not confess to the murders of the men found in his backyard.<ref name="People1996"/>
Baumeister would posthumously be suspected of killing nine other men, the bodies of whom were found in rural areas along the corridor of [[Interstate 70]] between Indianapolis and [[Columbus, Ohio|Columbus]], [[Ohio]] during the early to mid 1980s. One eyewitness identified Baumeister as the man seen leaving a bar in 1983 with Michael Riley who was later found dead; like the other victims, Riley was strangled to death and deposited nude or semi-nude in a river.<ref>{{cite news |title=Indiana Businessman Is Linked To 9 Other Killings of Men |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1998/04/29/us/indiana-businessman-is-linked-to-9-other-killings-of-men.html |agency=[[Associated Press]]|work=The New York Times |date=April 29, 1998|accessdate=January 4, 2017}}</ref>
==Media coverage== The [[A&E (TV channel)|A&E]] television series ''Investigative Reports'' aired an episode about Baumeister titled ''The Secret Life of a Serial Killer'' in 1997.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Hall|first1=Steve|title=Baumeister program is chilling but flawed|url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/21146388/the_indianapolis_star/|accessdate=June 21, 2018|work=The Indianapolis Star|date=September 4, 1997|via=Newspapers.com}} {{free access}}</ref> [[History (U.S. TV channel)|History]] featured the case in their ''Perfect Crimes'' series. The case was also featured on ''[[The Investigators (TruTV series)|The Investigators]]'' on [[TruTV]] in 2008, ''[[Behind Mansion Walls]]'' on [[Investigation Discovery]] (ID) and ''[[Paranormal Witness]]'' on [[Syfy]] in 2012, and ''[[Ghost Adventures]]'' in May 2014. An independent documentary film titled ''The Haunting of Fox Hollow Farm'' also explores the crimes and the possibility of hauntings on the grounds of Baumeister's former home.<ref>{{IMDb title|2075337|The Haunting of Fox Hollow Farm}}</ref> ID featured the case again on the series ''True Nightmares'', in October 2015.<ref>{{IMDb title|5043530|True Nightmares}}</ref> The ''Crime Junkie'' podcast released an episode on Baumeister on March 4, 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://crimejunkiepodcast.com/serial-killer-herb-baumeister/|title=SERIAL KILLER: Herb Baumeister – Crime Junkie Podcast|website=crimejunkiepodcast.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-09-10}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}

[[File:Tyr1.jpg|thumb|upright]] '''Hugh II''' ({{circa}} 1106 – 1134), also called '''Hugh du Puiset''',{{efn|Also ''de Puiset'' or ''de Le Puiset''}} was a [[Crusade]]r and the [[Count of Jaffa]]. He revolted against King [[Fulk of Jerusalem]] in 1134.
==Arrival in the kingdom== Hugh was the son of [[Hugh I of Jaffa]] and his wife Mamilia (or Mabilla). According to [[William of Tyre]], his father had come to Jerusalem on a [[pilgrimage]] during the reign of [[Baldwin II of Jerusalem|Baldwin II]], and Hugh was born in [[Apulia]] during the journey. However, according to John L. La Monte, it is more likely that Hugh I came to the east with [[Bohemund I of Antioch|Bohemund of Taranto]] in 1106. In any case, Hugh I was named Count of Jaffa after his arrival (by [[Baldwin I of Jerusalem|Baldwin I]], if in 1106), but soon died.
When Hugh II came of age he arrived in Jerusalem to claim his inheritance, and married Emelota (or Emma), niece of the [[Latin Patriarch of Jerusalem|Patriarch]] [[Arnulf of Chocques]]. Hugh was a relative of [[Melisende of Jerusalem|Queen Melisende]], [[Fulk of Jerusalem|King Fulk]]'s wife, as their fathers Hugh I and Baldwin II were cousins; Melisende's grandmother, also named Melisende, was a sister of Hugh's grandmother Alice. Hugh had a close relationship with Melisende, but he "...was rumoured to be on too familiar terms with the queen..." (William of Tyre, 14.16) and came into conflict with a jealous Fulk. It was also rumoured that Hugh was simply arrogant and refused to pay [[Homage (feudal)|homage]] to Fulk. The latter rumour also seems to the basis of the account of [[Orderic Vitalis]]; according to him, Hugh and other nobles were offended by Fulk, who brought [[House of Châteaudun|Angevin]] nobles and counsellors with him when he became king, and ignored the native barons of the kingdom.
==The revolt against Fulk== In 1134 Hugh seems to have revolted against Fulk, along with [[Roman of Le Puy]], lord of [[Oultrejordain]]. According to William of Tyre, Hugh's stepson [[Walter I Grenier, Lord of Caesarea]] (Emelota's son through her first marriage to [[Eustace Grenier]]) accused Hugh of [[treason]] and [[Conspiracy (political)|conspiracy]] at a meeting of the ''[[Haute Cour of Jerusalem|Haute Cour]]''; Walter possibly did this with the urging of Fulk himself. Hugh denied the charges, and it was decided that the matter would be settled by [[trial by combat|judicial combat]]. When the appointed day arrived, Hugh did not appear, and he was found guilty ''[[trial in absentia|in absentia]]''.
He allied with the [[Egypt]]ian city of [[Ashkelon|Ascalon]], and Fulk invaded [[Jaffa, Israel|Jaffa]] and besieged the city. Hugh's [[vavasour|rear-vassal]]s, including [[Baldwin I of Ramla|Baldwin of Ramla]] and [[Barisan of Ibelin|Barisan]], constable of Jaffa, deserted him and "wisely betook themselves to the king." (William of Tyre, 14.16) The usual punishment for such actions was permanent exile and confiscation of the rebel's territories, but in this case, perhaps due to Hugh's high status in the kingdom and his relationship with the queen, the Patriarch William mediated in the dispute, and Hugh was exiled for only three years.
==Attempted assassination== [[File:Tyr1.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The Breton knight attacking Hugh]] Hugh was free to remain in Jerusalem while waiting for a ship to take him into exile. One day, while playing [[dice]] on the street, he was brutally attacked by a [[Brittany|Breton]] knight. The knight was quickly apprehended and convicted:
{{quote|No accuser or witnesses were necessary to prove the crime, for it was well known to all. Since the regular process of law was needless, therefore, the king ordered a sentence commensurate with his guilt to be pronounced upon the man. The court accordingly convened, and the assassin was sentenced by unanimous consent to suffer the penalty of mutilation of his members. The judgment was reported to the king, who ordered the sentence to be carried out.| William of Tyre, 14.18}}
Rumours spread that Fulk himself had hired the knight to [[assassination|assassin]]ate Hugh, and public opinion considered Hugh to be innocent of the charges of treason and conspiracy. Fulk ordered "...that the tongue should not be included among the members so mutilated", supposedly so that he would not be accused of trying to silence the knight. In any case, the knight claimed to have acted on his own:
{{quote|It was impossible to extort from the criminal, either in secret or in public, before or after the sentence was carried out, an admission that this monstrous act had been done by the order or with the knowledge of the king. On the contrary, he declared that he had ventured to do the deed on his own initiative in the hope of gaining the king's favor.|William of Tyre, 14.18}}
Nevertheless Fulk no longer had the support of the public in the dispute.
Hugh remained in the kingdom for a short time, while his wounds healed. He then went into exile in Apulia, where his relative [[Roger II of Sicily]] named him Count of Gargan. Hugh never fully recovered, and died soon after his arrival.
==Aftermath== Whether or not Fulk hired the Breton knight, he has been suspected, by Hans Mayer and other historians, of inciting Hugh to revolt so that he might take personal control of Jaffa. Because Hugh died before his three years of exile were over, his territories were confiscated and added to the royal domain, where they remained for the rest of the 12th century. Fulk began to build numerous castles in the area, including [[Ibelin (castle)|Ibelin]], to defend against Egyptian invasions. As a consequence of the revolt, the former rear-vassals of Jaffa became more powerful, such as [[Lordship of Ramla|Ramla]]. The lords of Ibelin and Ramla would become important in the affairs of the kingdom later in the century.
The dispute also led to a rift between Fulk and Melisende. Melisende, who legally ruled the kingdom in her own right with Fulk as consort, was supported by the Church and various other nobles, and Fulk and his supporters in the dispute for a time felt unwelcome and even unsafe. According to William of Tyre, "from that day forward, the king became so uxorious that...not even in unimportant cases did he take any measures without her knowledge and assistance." (William of Tyre, 14.18)
==Dating of the revolt== Hugh's revolt was previously dated to 1132, due to the evidence in William of Tyre and Arab historian [[Ibn al-Qalanisi]]. However, William's chronology is probably confused, and al-Qalanisi's references to conflicts in the kingdom probably refer to those between Fulk and [[Pons of Tripoli]] in 1132. Hugh appears as count of Jaffa in [[charter]]s dated to 1133 and 1134, and the date of 1134 is now accepted by most scholars.
==Notes== {{notelist}}
==Sources== *[[William of Tyre]], ''A History of Deeds Done Beyond the Sea'', Volume II. Trans. Emily Atwater Babcock and A. C. Krey. Columbia University Press, 1943. *John L. La Monte, ''Feudal Monarchy in the Latin Kingdom of Jerusalem, 1100–1291''. [[Mediaeval Academy of America]], 1932. *John L. La Monte, ''The Lords of Le Puiset on the Crusades''. ''[[Speculum (journal)|Speculum]]'' 17 (1942). *Hans Mayer, ''Studies in the History of Queen Melisende of Jerusalem''. Dumbarton Oaks Papers 26 (1972). *Steven Tibble, ''Monarchy and Lordships in the Latin Kingdom of Jerusalem, 1099–1291''. Clarendon Press, 1989.

{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2014}} {{over-quotation|date=August 2015}} {{Infobox writer <!-- for more information see [[:Template:Infobox writer/doc]] --> | name = Jack Hunter | image = Jack Hunter by Gage Skidmore.jpg | caption = Hunter in February 2011. | pseudonym = Southern Avenger, Big Baby | birth_name = Jack William Hunter, Jr. | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1974|6|1}} | birth_place = [[Hanahan, South Carolina|Hanahan]], [[South Carolina]], United States | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Radio host, writer, blogger | alma_mater = | spouse = }} '''Jack William Hunter, Jr.''' (born June 1, 1974) is an [[United States|American]] radio host, political commentator and Politics Editor for [[Rare (news website)|Rare.us]], a Washington, D.C.-based news website. He began his career in the late 1990s on alternative rock station WAVF 96.1 FM using the moniker "Southern Avenger", an anonymous pro wrestler/superhero-style character. In 2007, Hunter began appearing every Tuesday and Friday morning on [[WTMA]] News-Talk 1250 AM, and contributed to a weekly column to the ''[[Charleston City Paper]]''.<ref>[http://www.charlestoncitypaper.com/charleston/ArticleArchives?author=1072546 Jack Hunter at the Charleston City Paper]</ref> Hunter was also an aide to U.S. Senator [[Rand Paul]], whom Hunter helped write the book ''[[The Tea Party Goes to Washington]]''.<ref name=usatoday0609>{{cite news|last=Carroll|first=James R.|last2=Gerth|first2=Joseph|title=Rand Paul staffer expressed support for Lincoln assassination|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2013/07/09/rand-paul-staffer-southern-avenger/2502637/|newspaper=USA Today|date=June 9, 2013}}</ref> He is perhaps best known for his decades-old, racially charged writings whose reemergence caused a major media controversy for his boss, Senator Paul.
Hunter's reputation as a political operative was discredited following the ''[[Washington Free Beacon]]'''s revelation in July 2013 that he had repeatedly espoused racist views on a local South Carolina radio station under the Southern Avenger moniker. His racist comments included expressions of contempt for Hispanic immigrants, and a call for NAACP director [[Kweisi Mfume]], whom he referred to as "NAACP Grand Wizard," to be tied to a tree and whipped.<ref>Goodman, Alana (July 22, 2013). [http://freebeacon.com/politics/the-confederacy-loses-again/ "The Confederacy Loses Again."] The Washington Free Beacon.</ref><ref name="politico.com">Hunter, Jack. [http://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2013/11/confessions-of-right-wing-shock-jock-jack-hunter-100261.html#.VIYV8DHF_g8 "Confessions of a Right-Wing Shock Jock."] ''Politico'', November 25, 2013</ref> Following these revelations, Hunter resigned from Rand Paul's staff in what the Senator called a "mutual decision." In a November 2013 article for ''[[Politico]]'', Hunter repudiated his former views, writing "I'm not a racist; I just played one on the radio."<ref name=Politico_Hunter_25Nov13> {{cite news | last = Hunter | first = Jack | date = 25 Nov 2013 | title = Confessions of a Right-Wing Shock Jock – I'm not a racist; I just played one on the radio | url = https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2013/11/confessions-of-right-wing-shock-jock-jack-hunter-100261 | work = PoliticoMagazine | location = Alexandria, Va | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20150924044857/https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2013/11/confessions-of-right-wing-shock-jock-jack-hunter-100261 | archive-date = 24 Sep 2015 | access-date = 23 July 2018 }} </ref>
==Political views== Hunter is known for often providing commentary from [[libertarian]] and [[conservative]] viewpoints, with a particular focus on Ron Paul's 2008 and 2012 presidential campaigns as well as Senator Rand Paul's influence within the Republican Party. Hunter has said he sees the [[liberal internationalism]] that is found in the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] and the [[neoconservatism]] prominent in the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] to be ultimately indistinguishable from one another, which has led to criticism from both the mainstream left and the mainstream right.{{citation needed|date=August 2015}}
Hunter supports a [[non-interventionist]] foreign policy and considers the current U.S. foreign policy a disaster.<ref>https://www.charlestoncitypaper.com/charleston/foreign-intervention-can-create-more-problems-than-it-solves/Content?oid=3637705</ref> He is also critical of [[neoconservatism]].<ref>https://www.theamericanconservative.com/2011/06/23/whats-a-neoconservative/</ref>
==Controversy over writings on race, American Civil War== Hunter became the center of controversy in 2013 when the ''[[Washington Free Beacon]]'' reported that he had once espoused racist views on a local South Carolina radio station under the Southern Avenger moniker. His comments included expressions of contempt for Hispanic immigrants, and a call for [[NAACP]] director [[Kweisi Mfume]], whom he referred to as "NAACP Grand Wizard," to be tied to a tree and whipped.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Goodman|first1=Alana|title=The Confederacy Loses Again|url=http://freebeacon.com/politics/the-confederacy-loses-again/|website=Free Beacon|publisher=The Washington Free Beacon|accessdate=July 22, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Hunter|first1=Jack|title=Confessions of a Right-Wing Shock Jock|url=http://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2013/11/confessions-of-right-wing-shock-jock-jack-hunter-100261.html#.VTxrb2RVikp|website=Politico|accessdate=November 25, 2013}}</ref> Following these revelations, Hunter resigned from Rand Paul's staff in what the Senator called a "mutual decision."
Hunter's writings were reported by numerous mainstream media outlets on July 9, 2013. The Washington Post noted that Hunter had previously written that "Americans aren't wrong to deplore the millions of Hispanics coming here" and that "a non-white majority America would simply cease to be America."
The ''Free Beacon'' also noted that Hunter had previously written in support of the [[assassination of Abraham Lincoln]], and formerly had served as a chairman of the [[League of the South]], which advocates [[Secession in the United States|Southern secession]] and, according to the [[Anti-Defamation League]], promotes the idea of [[White supremacy|a society dominated by whites]].<ref name=goodman0709>{{cite news|last=Goodman|first=Alana|title=Rebel Yell: Rand Paul aide has history of neo-Confederate sympathies, inflammatory statements|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2013/07/09/rand-paul-staffer-southern-avenger/2502637/|newspaper=Washington Free Beacon|date=July 9, 2013}}</ref> Hunter was also criticized for suggesting that African-American director Spike Lee be tied to a tree and whipped for his critical comments about Mel Gibson's movie, ''[[The Patriot (2000 film)|The Patriot]]''.<ref name="politico.com"/>
Critics on both the political left<ref>{{cite web|title='The Rachel Maddow Show' for Tuesday July 9, 2013|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/id/52440007/ns/msnbc-rachel_maddow_show/#.VTxyc2RViko|website=NBC News|accessdate=July 10, 2013}}</ref> and the political right<ref>{{cite web|last1=Rubin|first1=Jennifer|title=Jack Hunter and Rand Paul 'playing the game'|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/right-turn/wp/2013/07/12/jack-hunter-and-rand-paul-playing-the-game/|website=The Washington Post|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> condemned Hunter for the past remarks, and some political analysts said that Senator Rand Paul's continuing association with Hunter would imperil Paul's prospects as a contender in the [[United States presidential election, 2016]].
On July 18, Hunter's former longtime editor at the ''Charleston City Paper'', Chris Haire, wrote an article sharply critical of both Hunter and Paul, denouncing Hunter for having asked Haire, long before the current controversy had erupted, to remove from the internet dozens of past columns that Hunter said no longer reflected his views.<ref name=chrishaire>{{cite news|last=Haire|first=Chris|title=Former editor of Rand Pauls neo-confederate staffer talks about the Southern Avenger; Jack Hunter asked me to delete columns|url=http://www.charlestoncitypaper.com/HaireoftheDog/archives/2013/07/18/former-editor-of-rand-pauls-neo-confederate-staffer-talks-about-the-southern-avenger|newspaper=Charleston City Paper|date=July 18, 2013}}</ref> Haire called the request cowardly and said that Hunter had made it solely for appearances—to help Paul in the 2016 presidential campaign.<ref name=chrishaire/> Noting controversial writings by Hunter "in support of racially profiling Hispanics, praising white supremacist [[Samuel T. Francis|Sam Francis]], blast[ing] the House of Representative's apology for slavery" and calling upon black Americans to "apologize to white people for their high crime rates", Haire characterized Hunter as "the most common kind of racist, the one that doesn't realize that he is one".<ref name="chrishaire" />
By July 21, less than two weeks after the original ''Washington Free Beacon'' article had been published, Hunter had resigned from his position on Paul's staff, saying he wanted to avoid being a distraction for the senator.<ref name=antle>{{cite news|last=Antle III|first=W. James|title=Jack Hunter leaves Rand Paul staff, returns to punditry|url=http://dailycaller.com/2013/07/21/controversial-rand-paul-aide-leaves-staff-returns-to-punditry/|newspaper=The Daily Caller|date=July 22, 2013}}</ref> Hunter also said he would return to political commentary.<ref name=antle/> Paul called the resignation "a mutual decision," agreeing that Hunter's past views had become a distraction.<ref>{{cite news|last=Brammer|first=Jack|title=Sen. Rand Paul confirms departure of staffer who spoke fondly of Lincoln's assassination|url=http://www.kentucky.com/2013/07/22/2725939/sen-rand-paul-confirms-departure.html|newspaper=Lexington Herald-Leader|date=July 22, 2013}}</ref>
In a statement written in response to the controversy, Hunter wrote that he was "embarrassed by some of the comments I made precisely because they do not represent me today."<ref name=hunterresponse0709>{{cite web|last=Hunter|first=Jack|title=My statement on recent attacks|date=July 9, 2013|accessdate=July 9, 2013|url=http://www.southernavenger.com/uncategorized/my-statement-on-recent-attacks/|publisher=Southern Avenger (blog)}}</ref> He also expressed abhorrence of racism and criticized the ''Free Beacon'' article as "not accurately reflect[ing]" his character or views.<ref name=hunterresponse0709/> In June 2015, Hunter wrote a piece in ''[[The Daily Beast]]'' condemning his past promotion of Confederate iconography in light of the [[Charleston church shooting]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2015/06/22/the-southern-avenger-repents-i-was-wrong-about-the-confederate-flag|title=The 'Southern Avenger' Repents: I Was Wrong About the Confederate Flag|last=Hunter|first=Jack|date=2015-06-22|work=The Daily Beast|access-date=2018-01-24|language=en}}</ref> He continues to express regret about his past views and opposes the alt right and other movements that promote white nationalism or racial hatreds.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20130528145347/http://www.southernavenger.com/ Jack Hunter "The Southern Avenger" Home Page] * {{imdb name|3642901}} * [http://www.charlestoncitypaper.com/charleston/jack-hunter-goes-to-washington/Content?oid=3189069 Jack Hunter Goes to Washington], ''[[Charleston City Paper]]'' * [http://rare.us/story/why-are-people-sharing-freddie-grays-criminal-record/ Jack Hunter "Why Are People Sharing Freddy Gray's Criminal Record"] * [http://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2015/07/republicans-gay-marriage-angry-119711.html#.VZxoOflVhBc Republicans Are Too Angry About Gay Marriage] * [http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2015/06/22/the-southern-avenger-repents-i-was-wrong-about-the-confederate-flag.html The ‘Southern Avenger’ Repents: I Was Wrong About the Confederate Flag]
{{Authority control}}In March of 2017, Jack Hunter is reported to have sent his wife a divorce notice via email. https://www.facebook.com/celebritarianmagazine/photos/a.421159818007871.1073741828.413214485469071/504863009637551/?type=3&theater
